website_summaries.verdict: 3 blades provide enough coverage for smaller faces while maintaining the power and flexibility of larger Panasonic models.
pros: A 13,000 cuts per minute motor provides good power to this smaller Panasonic model
The pivoting head offers great maneuverability, especially in a model this size
Waterproof for wet and dry shaving
cons: Users with larger faces may find this model too slow for their liking

customer_reviews.title: It works so much better than the Panasonic and other shavers I've had
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to shave my legs with. I'm a female. It works so much better than the Panasonic and other shavers I've had. It shaves closer, charges within an hour, and the charge lasts for 3-4 uses. I use is dry and it works well. It has indicators for the % charge it has, when it needs charging, and when it needs cleaning using the ultra-sonic setting. I'm very pleased with it. I'm looking forward to seeing how it operates after about 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Overall I really like it. Has nice features
customer_reviews.text: This is my first foil shaver. Usually all I use to shave is simply the lowest setting on my trimmer and shave my head and face all at once. My girlfriend is the one who wanted me to get a closer shave and seeing as how I haven't shaved with a razor in over 20 years I figured I'd try this. Overall I really like it. Has nice features, gets a close shave fairly quickly and recharges fast. Only gripe is it takes multiple passes to get everything. Overall though I'm still very happy with it and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A.J.

customer_reviews.title: Good model for ladies, better than ladies version.
customer_reviews.text: I got this model after my ladies Panasonic lost its edge. The quality is much better than my old one. Not perfect but good. Get about 5 uses before needs charging. I like the charging status window. The ladies model did not have this feature. Recharge was fast. Easy to clean. And best of all, no nubs!
customer_reviews.author: digikeiki

customer_reviews.title: For Wet Shaving, an Outstanding Shaver and Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a Panasonic wet/dry shaver since they first came on the market (yes, that many years). I've always used it wet with shaving cream, until I discovered shaving gel - a major leap forward in the march towards the perfect shave. I don't have a heavy beard. This model (LT41) shaves as close and as comfortably as Panasonic shavers costing twice as much, including the Arc4 shavers. If you decide to try wet shaving, I highly recommend using either King of Shaves or Lily of the Desert shaving GEL -- very close shave with no burn or irritation, and the gel rinses easily off the blades and screen (no need for additional cleaning).
customer_reviews.author: Michael - Desert-Rat

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good
customer_reviews.text: For the basic function of a razor, the shave, this is great. It is fast and it is pain free. I can shave after three days of growth super fast, with no burn, even without showering after to eliminate potential burn. I've never had a razor that could do that. It is not perfect, though. Sometimes there will be one random hair it just can't grab. The battery doesn't last as long as my past razors. The trimmer is aggressive and imprecise, good for cleaning up patches of hair such as neck, but not good for getting the neck line or trimmer back sideburns.
customer_reviews.author: Illiterati

customer_reviews.title: Love the small form factor and great shave
customer_reviews.text: I've been shaving with the Panasonic 8103 model for a number of years now and it has been my best shaver ever but I just purchased this model and I like it better because it is smaller and lighter but gives the same excellent results. I do think it might give less shaves per charge due to the smaller size but with 1 hour for complete charge that is no problem. The smaller form factor makes this a great shaver and you can't buy a better electric shave anywhere near this cost.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Wayne S. Mergott Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Effective Razor for the price
customer_reviews.text: You can spend as much as you want to on an electric razor, but I am very pleased with the cost v performance of this razor. It doesn't tug or pull on your whiskers and give you a reasonably close comfortable shave. I also find that the battery lasts as advertised. Good product overall. Pros - Comfortable shave, excellent battery. Works well wet or dry. Con - not the easiest razor to clean, but not difficult enough to deduct a star.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Just got it...very nice shave...but LOUD!
customer_reviews.text: I just used it for the first time and the shave was very nice...and close. Hope it keeps doing that and the blades don't have to be replaced too often. Re the noise: I used a Norelco rotary for the last 10 years that was VERY quiet. This is VERY noisy....even my wife heard it in the far reaches of our house. For anyone with an ear affliction where loud noises bother them, this may not be your shaver. Maybe I'll get used to it (or maybe I'm doing something wrong) but you could almost wear ear protection when using this....I'm serious.
customer_reviews.author: JCD

customer_reviews.title: Almost Razer Good
customer_reviews.text: My last Panasonic worked for decades but wear n tear won out in deciding on an upgrade. After reviewing so many options, chose this model and am satisfied. It always takes longer to use electric vs manual but no nics or cuts. The sleek design is easy to handle, navigating all shapes and angles. There is a lock button for the On/Off Switch which definitely comes in handy, due to location conflict during usage. Perhaps there are higher performing options but in this price range, this is optimal. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DoMeNiQuE  CoE

customer_reviews.title: Great reliable shaver foot a close shave
customer_reviews.text: This is an older model and sold as brand new in box, which it was. I believe it was in storage for a while as the battery was completely drained when I received it. However, once charge it did hold a charge and continues to be reliable. The only down side I see is that the battery life may have been affected as I only get four 10 minute shaves before needing a charge. This is my 5th Panasonic of this model design. My others would last longer between shaves. For the price and the fact that I do not travel much with it, I would buy this same shaven again and again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after one month
customer_reviews.text: This shaver quit working after about one month of use. Telephone support is not available; you have to use "chat." I was told that, if I brought the shaver to a local service center, the warranty would not apply, and I would have to pay for repairs or for a new charger if that turns out to be the problem. I have to email the company; wait up to 2 days for them to respond with information on where to send the shaver; send it at my own cost; wait for them to repair/replace the shaver; and wait for the new one to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke up in 2 months. Doesn’t turn on
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item 2 months ago, hoping to have a long-lasting shaver for my trip. Just yesterday started to turn on automatically, allowing me to turn it off by using the blocking system. Today, I cannot even turn it on at all. It charges and pops up the charging symbol, after I disconnect the cable; the lock symbols blinks 5 times and then nothing happens. I read the manual and there is nothing about it. What a shame, I guess I will have to go back to other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo

customer_reviews.title: Really recommend
customer_reviews.text: From 1997 to now, only three razors have been changed, all of this brand. The first one was used until 2015 and the second one was changed (the second one was bought in 2008 and kept at home as a spare). The second one may have been stored for too long. It only took 5 years and finally went on strike last week. . I bought this immediately, and I have always believed in this label, hoping to continue to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Stop searching...buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this shaver for my husband which was a replacement for a Remington. Unsure of what brand to purchase and knowing the one he had was not the greatest, I relied on reviews for the decision making process. I LOVE THIS SHAVER! It gives him the closest shave I have ever seen an electric razor give him in the 30 years we have been together. He had a Braun and Norelco prior to the Remington. I cannot say enough about this product. It does not tear up his neck or miss any whiskers, exceptionally quiet and holds the charge better than the last ones he has had. Buy this and you will be happy.
customer_reviews.author: ABOMAMA

customer_reviews.title: Close shave and well designed wet/dry razor
customer_reviews.text: I really like this razor. My Braun was 10 years old, and had the base cleaning unit that required buying cleaning fluid cartridges. This one is wet or dry and easy to clean with just running water. The shave is close and ergonomic feel is good. I get at least 10 shaves out of battery before recharge needed. LED display tells you % of battery left, so you know if it will be needing charge soon, which is helpful when packing it for a short trip. May be my imagination, but it seems to run at higher vibrations per second than my old razor. Pop-up side burn trimmer works well.
customer_reviews.author: EIB fan

customer_reviews.title: BEST shaver ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness...........why did I wait so many years to buy this shaver? The very best electric shaver I have ever used in my 56 years! I'm totally SOLD on this Panasonic shaver............worth the extra money for sure!!! Flex head works super good and doesn't miss one single hair!!! No more going over and over one spot to get a problem hair.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo Craig

customer_reviews.title: The Ratings Are Wrong !!!
customer_reviews.text: Once again I bought this Razor for 2 reasons : 1 It was a Panasonic and 2 it had great reviews ........Well as a guy who has been using Electric Razors for over 30 years I am beyond disappointed .........It does shave close but sure does look good. I have never gotten razor burn from an electric till I used this one.........Maybe it is me but it is not as advertised !!!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Z.

customer_reviews.title: Second one
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time owning this razor. The first one literally lasted me 10 years before the battery finally died. That was enough to talk me into buying the same one again. Would 100% recommend!
customer_reviews.author: BrianTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Powerful shaver...good value
customer_reviews.text: Great shaver. I do agree with previous reviews regarding sensitive skin. This shaver has a very high torque motor, it doesn't play around. I have not used it in the shower yet, but it is nice to know it offers wet/dry operation when needed. Great to have the battery % remaining in display. Charges fairly quickly. Shaves much closer than the Braun it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: brian ellis

customer_reviews.title: Shavers Are The New Printers
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this shaver. After a couple of months, the quality of shave goes down dramatically. The replacement heads and blades last about a month or two and they too become dull and provide a poor shave. They aren’t cheap either. This is the second Panasonic I’ve bought and the experience is the same. I’m trying a new, supposedly better model soon, but it might be my last. I’ve had similar experiences with the other legacy shaver brands. It seems they all have adopted the old printer business model; keep the cost of the equipment down and make the consumer pay longterm with overpriced supplies. Next time I’ll try one of the cheap Chinese knockoffs.
customer_reviews.author: C. Molinaro

customer_reviews.title: Please read the explanation why four stars!
customer_reviews.text: I like this shaver. I like it a lot, but I gave it 4 stars. My reason is that it does not shave well the left side of my jaw! The right side is ok. I do not know if this is because I am right handed and it works out that the left side is positioned differently? Aside from that, this shaver is good. It trims my mustache (I do the trimming and it does a good jobs). My sideburns are done with ease. Cleaning is easy and it hold enough charge to last me a week or more.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Moezzi

customer_reviews.title: Ladies, this one is worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: No more wimpy women's shavers for me. This thing does all the area's beautifully without pinching or cutting. Even the bikini area. My last ladies shaver would pinch and cut the skin if it was not super, tight and left me feeling like I had a full days stubble even after going over it repeatedly. This one feels like you shaved and does it quickly. Stop paying the pink tax and switch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Way is this a replacement for a regular blade razor
customer_reviews.text: There is No comparison between this electric razor and a true blade razor for a smooth shave. At best this is for a quick cut to the nub for a rough look. I spent 10 minutes trying to get this razor to cut some stand alone patches and hairs to no avail. It simply wont do it. Would not recommend for a replacement to a blade. Can barely recommend purchase to be used for a stand by unless you are going for a rough look.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Horrible for the money
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my old Remington MS2, this thing is a joke. Bought it about 3 mos ago. Possibly its better with wet shaving, but dry shaving is an absolute chore. It shaves whiskers in such microscopic particles that you'll create a messy accumulation of them all over a vanity. And you'll have to rub, rub, rub to get any results. I've tried various pressure and that's the only method that works. For a close shave, I usually have to finish up with the old Remington. Its battery is giving up, and its still a better performer. Don't buy the hype on this one, and don't buy it period.
customer_reviews.author: Tim White

customer_reviews.title: Received USED product!
customer_reviews.text: Received today, 6/16/20. Once opened same day, discovered a lot of hair inside clipper. When purchased, description said I would be getting a new clipper. Very misleading and disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still awesome after 4 years!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this shaver for 4 years and I love it! Note, I did replace the outer/inner foil once in this time. It is still effective and convenient at shaving my face. In fact, I purchased a brand new shaver at a lower price point ($40, Philips Norelco Electric shaver 3100, S3310/81 series 3000), but it could not match my 4-year old Panasonic ES-LT41! The charger worked in Hong Kong, Japan, and Australia, with relevant power plug converters.
customer_reviews.author: Ameal

customer_reviews.title: A super close and quick shave. Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: For decades I have been a "Braun" electric razor snob!...lol. However, while traveling this past November I used my Pop's razor. I was quite surprised at just how close and quick the shave was! I am now a "Phillips Norelco" snob....lol. A fantastic wet or dry shave. I particularly like the option of a "soft" shave (the head and foil actuate up and down, side to side, dependant on the amount of pressure applied) or flip a switch and *poof!* now it's a "firm" shave with no head/foil movement.
customer_reviews.author: Boondog

customer_reviews.title: 3 months and unit will not power on!
customer_reviews.text: The shaver will now power on or unlock. Charge light comes one. it essentialy useless. didnt eve make it 4 months! Chinese trash
customer_reviews.author: J. Eric Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Value
customer_reviews.text: This shaver has a lot going for it: close shave, comfortable ergonomics, effectiveness of programmed cleaning. My only gripe is that the cleaning mode drains the battery enough to require frequent charging; charging takes quite a long time too. Otherwise a stellar shaver at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Greg M.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great till it didn't!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this shaver for 1 year and it worked great till it suddenly stopped working. As shown in the video it just flashes the red light continuously. It did that for almost two days before stopping. I tried charging it afterwards but that just recharged the battery to restart the blinking. I had no issues for 1 year and the shaves I was getting were great so in that sense I liked it a lot. But my last shaver lasted me almost 4 years so I expected this to last at least half of that since it's not a cheap option!
customer_reviews.author: ikthreeo

customer_reviews.title: A continued favorite
customer_reviews.text: Despite a different model name I have used this shaver since the early nineties. It is without a doubt a continued favorite now with a few improvements. Better grip, a locking power switch, & new colors to delight. On the low end, the motor sounds a bit louder. Will this translate to a quick burn out one hopes not? Replacement parts are inexpensive and readily available.
customer_reviews.author: KRB

customer_reviews.title: Close shave and great price
customer_reviews.text: I just got this shaver since my other day since my old died on me. I was looking for something for a good price and worked well for course hair. Other shavers I got recommended were double or triple the price of this one. Before this I had a Braun series 3 shaver. This new Panasonic shaver blows that braun series 3 out of the water. Nearly 2 days later after I shaved there is barely any stubble. The Panasonic shave was so easy and shaved extremely close. I would definitely recommend this, especially if you have dark course hair.
customer_reviews.author: ashton b goshorn

customer_reviews.title: An OK shave but very noisy and runs hot
customer_reviews.text: Have shaved with this every day for past 8 months. First the good points: Well made, nice display and easy to clean. Now the not so good: Takes many passes to get a close shave. Very noisy. Very warm on the face. Down to 10% charge after about 6 shaves. There is a lot of friction in this design which causes the noisy, hot operation and short run time.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie's Guy

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally use an electric razor. This was bought for traveling and it hasn't disappointed. It holds a charge for 14 or more days and charges quickly. It provides a great shave. Wet rinsing is a nice touch. The pivoting head makes for a wonderful shave.
customer_reviews.author: A Nurd

customer_reviews.title: Soft and effective
customer_reviews.text: Soft? Yes, this is my second Panasonic. The first series I had sounded like a lawn mower and decimated any hair in its way, often at the cost of razor bumps. I was initially disappointed at this model as it was much quieter and seemingly less effective, but going toward a year in, and I have grown fond of it. It is just as effective as my other, while being much more gentle and easy on the skin.
customer_reviews.author: Cat reviews

customer_reviews.title: Tough/impossible to get a close shave
customer_reviews.text: Needed to switch to electric for medical reasons. Have not been able to trim neck and jaw line successfully. Does not cut close or even no matter the starting hair length nor wet or dry. The instructions state to use for a month before deciding. It had been a month and the shave is not much better than the first week. Would not keep using if it wasn’t necessary for me to stick with electric.
customer_reviews.author: John Cook

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for a clean shave
customer_reviews.text: Don’t expect a clean shave using this item. It’s good if you have scruff from not shaving for a week and need to pre-shave b4 shaving. Even if my boyfriend were to use this daily it wouldn’t work to give a clean shave. Disappointed, but didn’t return.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Even better than my last Panasonic!
customer_reviews.text: I've used many shavers over many years and I'm completely sold on the Panasonic brand. Best shaver for me, bar none! I've never used either of my Panasonics as a wet shaver, but dry shaving is so good I don't need to try shaving wet. Great shaver!
customer_reviews.author: Believer

customer_reviews.title: Three blades give a great cut too!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this model previously. It lasted about five years, giving a great shave, and now the battery is going out. I'm just replacing it. The three blade cut works just fine for me. It's a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: D. Presley

customer_reviews.title: QUIET SHARP & FAST!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this razor for myself, and liked it so much, I purchased 2 more for my sons!... This razor is very quiet, very fast,(blades rotating @ 13,000rpm) and smooth!!... I've owned several Braun razors for about 10 years now, and LOVE this panasonic compared to them!!... I've shaved dry, and have no problems!!!...clean-up is quick with soap & water!!!....LOVE THE DIGITAL BATTERY STRENGTH READOUT!!!... My only con, would be, that the construction of this razor seems a bit "lighter" and "plasticy"(if that's a word)....more like a "toy".... If it holds up as good as my Brauns, I'll be back!!!!....DEFINITELY!!!....If not, I'll be back to down grade my rating!!!.... Recommend????.....YOU BET!!....Can't go wrong for $72.00 spent on this razor!!!
customer_reviews.author: NEOGEO303

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic makes the best electric razors.
customer_reviews.text: Second Panasonic electric razor I have used. The first one lasted is still going strong but it was almost cheaper to buy a new one than replace the foil and blades. This new razor is awesome. Great shave.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic shaver does an okay job
customer_reviews.text: I bought the ES-LT41-K when an older Panasonic model finally began to wear out. It does an okay job, but I can't say it shaves any better than the older, less expensive model I used for 5 years. Pros: I actually like the ultrasonic cleaning mode: it works quite well and was a feature my previous shaver didn't have. It provides a decent shave (but not noticeably better than previous shaver) Cons: Large bulbous shaving head makes it somewhat difficult to get a close shave just under my nose. All in all it works fine. Just not thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: R. ManningTop Contributor: Raspberry Pi

customer_reviews.title: No hair pulling and nice battery.
customer_reviews.text: First time using Panasonic shavers. So far I am happy. Does not pull hair like other shavers seem to do, which I hated! Charges very fast and keeps change well. Get about 5 to 6 shaves off one charge. So far happy switching to Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Dave

customer_reviews.title: Older Panasonics Were Better
customer_reviews.text: I previously used a Panasonic Smooth Operator Wet/Dry razor (always using it wet). I decided to upgrade to newer Panasonic model only to be very disappointed. The newer model has a higher speed, which seems like it should be an upgrade, but it is more of disappointment. It tugs at my skin (in wet mode) and causes nicks. After a month or so of use I've decided to obsolete this purchase and resume using a much lower speed Braun wet/dry razor (an interim purchase) as it provides a irrigation-free wet shave that is close and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Limestone

customer_reviews.title: You can’t go wrong!
customer_reviews.text: You can’t go wrong with this electric shaver. It is very ergonomic so it makes it easy to maneuver around your face. The shave is nice and close almost like using a blade. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Del Carmen

customer_reviews.title: It's been a great razor for SIX years!
customer_reviews.text: This razor works really well and I've been using it for 6 years now. Don't keep it on the charger, just use it until it runs out of charge, and then recharge it and you'll have a razor that works great for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Comes w only 2 trimmer attachments, 6 heights! too difficult to make 3 attachments? 😢
customer_reviews.text: Great shaver, but typically when u try to make anything "all purpose" u will sacrafice on features. It is definately lacking on trimmer adjustments! No 4 MIL. I've been stuck between 3 & 5 for months! 😢
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Might want to look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I am four months into owning my razor and it's dead as disco. On the charger all night last night and no response from it. Plugged it into another charging spot to try again. Get a little red light that it's charging for about 2 seconds then goes dark. Will not turn on even when plugged into the wall. Have followed all the troublshooting items in the manual.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P. Blakeman

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money !!
customer_reviews.text: Received this shaver on April 24, 2019. My father is 91 yrs old and he gets a shave once a week at his day care facility. So we are looking an approximate usage of maybe 10 times. It is already history. Not shaving properly and making a a loud buzzing sound when turned on. Would not recommend this razor !!!!!!!!! A waste of money !
customer_reviews.author: cbsmitty

customer_reviews.title: Blade life extremely short
customer_reviews.text: This shaver was a disappointment because the blade only lasted for about 10-12 shaves, and it never did cut the neck hair. The battery life was great, but I don't think this product is worth it if you have to replace the blade every month.
customer_reviews.author: countrygalut

customer_reviews.title: Very good razor, but loud.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this razor based on the reviews and a lot of them mentioned that this thing is quiet. It’s not. It’s not louder than any other electric razor I’ve owned, so I will keep it, but i am disappointed that it is not quiet. Other than that, it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Justin P

customer_reviews.title: Great shaver for travel long battery life
customer_reviews.text: I have been a long time Panasonic shaver user. I have the bigger more expensive model and it works fine but I was shocked how expensive the replacement head and blades were. So for the same price almost I got this model for my trip and it worked fantastic. The head is smaller but it shaved close and held its charge for a couple of weeks, because of the smaller size and long battery life it made a perfect travel shaver for long trips. And it's compatible for charging in Europe. 5 stars for quality, long battery life and close shave.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: Smooth W/ No Irritation
customer_reviews.text: I am soooo glad I bought the hybrid shaver. It gets my head baby butt smooth with no irritation. I have been using this shaver everyday/every other day since I got it. I'm addicted to how soft this shaver gets my head, it's amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Blaze

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with this shaver
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a few Norelco and Braun shavers over the decades. They were OK. Of the two Braun is a bit nicer. This is my first Panasonic shaver and I'm very happy with the quality and closeness of the shave.
customer_reviews.author: Uinta Hiker

customer_reviews.title: I enjoyed using this I guess
customer_reviews.text: This Is exactly what I wanted. No problems here. Not much to say about it other than it fulfills the needs that I wanted for this product. I enjoyed using this I guess? Seems reliable and trustworthy, but only time will tell. I've owned it for about 3 weeks, and it has no problems but I will give an update in a couple more weeks to see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Lee

customer_reviews.title: Runs okay, but leaves debris scattered around
customer_reviews.text: Hard to see one's chin beard and lower mustache due to shape of razor. It is noisy but runs okay. Debris from beard and mustache tends to scatter everywhere as there is no basket to catch the hair.
customer_reviews.author: Customer in VA

customer_reviews.title: Good Device
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this device for a wet and dry shave. He likes that it's easy to clean, doesn't irritate his skin, and gets the job done. He uses it 5 days a week since he's required to be completely clean shaven for his job. It has held up well and still gives a clean, smooth shave after about 3 months of use. We are highly satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Sayler Hasty

customer_reviews.title: Not Perfect, But Almost
customer_reviews.text: After years of being a blade shaver, I thought I'd try an electric. I did my homework and this one seemed the best for the price. I used it once in the shower, but wet shaving isn't for me. I have a couple of areas that the hair grows rather fast, so I shave with a razor once a week as electrics aren't the best for longer hair and do the clean up with this the rest of the week. It cleans easily. Now, I'd never be without it. I can do a quick clean up before going out or before bed and it works great. Has a great trimmer also.
customer_reviews.author: GMAN

customer_reviews.title: Great shave/quiet
customer_reviews.text: I have bought my husband a few electric shavers In the past when he has use them they’re so loud I ask him to do it when I’m not around this shaver Has minimal noise and I have no problem being in the same room when he shaves Now
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic shaver, keeps a charge for many shaves. The only thing I liked better on my former Braun was the pop up trimmer is much better on the Braun. I still use the old Braun for side burn trim or to shave off neck fuzz, just easier. I get a real close shave, but to get it, go vertical and then at the end go horizontal. Without this method, it will leave some close stuff behind. I had to do this with the Braun as well. Overall, fast motor, keeps a great charge and able to place under water for rinsing which I only do once in awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Sense

customer_reviews.title: I'm well pleased so far....
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the shaver for a few weeks and so cannot comment on battery life, the durability of the shaver itself, etc. But it sure gives a good shave. It feels like a quality instrument, is easy to keep clean and is quieter than most shavers. The 2 blades can be removed and rotated (somewhat like tires on a car), which should allow them to wear evenly. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: D. Heinsen

customer_reviews.title: Reviews were kind, and spot on-so far.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I am new to electric razors, and female. I was looking quick and easy maintenance, do the job without fuss, close enough to do facial hair, ez charge and fast. It fit all the bills. It does a fine job on my teensy chin hairs and post menopausal mustache, and in a pinch it can do your legs or arms. It charges quickly. I haven't used it much, We'll see how it cleans. But, so far, so good
customer_reviews.author: C. Braden

customer_reviews.title: NOT SHARP ENOUGH
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Electric Razor thinking it would do a nice job, when i tried it for about 4 times i found it no better than my old Norelco with the old fashion circular blades. In fact, my old Norelco still does a better job than the ES-LT41-K Arc3 Panasonic. I feel that for the price, we all can get a better shaver.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Panasonic razor
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several Panasonic razors over the years and this is the best. It shaves close, is quiet and I love the digital readout of the amount of charge left. UPDATE: I have had this shaver for over a year and still believe it is the best. I shave not only my beard & mustache area, but also my entire head so it appears bald. One thing that I didn't mention before is that the shaver notifies you via icons when it needs a charge and also when it needs a cleaning (washing).
customer_reviews.author: BlacKnight

customer_reviews.title: Great for women's legs
customer_reviews.text: This is used by my wife for her legs. She got tired of using a regular razor. After about a week of getting used to it, she now likes it a lot. She did not like the electric razors for women as they were not as well built, were expensive for what they delivered, and didn't work any better.
customer_reviews.author: BobV

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far, I love this trimmer. It has worked well for me. It does quick and thorough work and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Les Stockton

customer_reviews.title: One Great Shaver
customer_reviews.text: Had been using a Norelco rotary for the past 7 years but not getting as close a shave as I liked. Read the reviews on this Panasonic model and decided to give it a try. It is as advertised. Gives a good close shave and is totally waterproof. Feels good in the hand and is very easy to clean. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: D. W.

customer_reviews.title: Good shaver, very short life.
customer_reviews.text: I like the speed of the shaving head. Panasonic's shave my face very well. However after 3 months the battery totally failed. It will not charge, shaver won't turn on. It is dead.
customer_reviews.author: BBD

customer_reviews.title: Good shave
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my es8103 with this. This is much quieter. Only thing I don’t like is no battery indicator on this one
customer_reviews.author: Ronald L. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Best electric razor I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Best electric razor I've owned. After yet another failed attempt with Braun (worst razor ever) and a couple of terribly mediocre Norelco jokes, I thankfully found this Panasonic. I'm very pleased with it. UPDATE Feb. 8, 2017: After almost a year and a half, this remains the BEST electric razor I've ever had. I'm extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Ty Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Very good shaver
customer_reviews.text: I love it. This is my second Panasonic shaver. My last one lasted over 7 years I think. I really should replace these every 2 years though, its worth it for the new blades, new foils, new battery, etc. My last one was almost just like this but without the button lock. Very well built. It does a great job of cutting too, it gives a very close shave.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shaver if you are clean-shaven.  A little difficult if you have a mustache & goatee.
customer_reviews.text: I have a mustache and goatee. There are some "tight" places around my mouth and the edges of my mustache and goatee that I have to use scissors and a smaller Remington electric shaver to get to. However, if I did not have those, this would be an excellent shaver for someone that is clean-shaven.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie L. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Nice shaver
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this shaver for the price. I am not thick bearded but if you want a quick easy shave everyday this is a nice razor and I like the pop out cutter also. Easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix User

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: three major cons 1 very noisy 2 the battery last just two to three shaves 3dry shaving is not smooth and just you have to shave wet to get an acceptable shave I was using Braun shaver before and i tried to replace it with Panasonic but I went back to it and its way better in every aspect comparing this model of Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: sean h

customer_reviews.title: Ditch the expensive, low quality rotatry razor
customer_reviews.text: Love this. After years of using a Norelco razor, I decided to switch to this and love.it. After Norelco quality dropped I was looking for a new razor. After reading the reviews, I took a chance on this razor and Im very happy. Its a little louder than the Norelco and you probably get 10 shaves per charge but other than that, Im sold.
customer_reviews.author: VA PharmD

customer_reviews.title: Fail
customer_reviews.text: This was expensive, it's just a shaver after all. It did not remove all hair, it was not a close enough shave, it burned skin, even with high-quality alcohol-free shaving gel/cream. Waste of my money. Gonna have to give it away or something. UGH!
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed to trim my beard and shave my face
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It works wet or dry and does a really good job as a beard trimmer and as a shaver.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Decelles

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Razor
customer_reviews.text: As a numer of other reviewers have stated, I found that this razor surpasses my previous Norelco in terms of shave closeness. I really like it!
customer_reviews.author: OBXr

customer_reviews.title: I am not satisfied with the quality of the shave
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this shaver for about a month mainly with water and gel cream. I am not satisfied with the quality of the shave. In places where the beard is heaviest, it takes forever and still does not give a close shave. The biggest problem for me however is the weird, funky smell that emanates from the blades and embeds in your face. This started after 2 shaves and the first time I rinsed it with warm, soapy water as directed. I try to keep the device really clean, but the odor does not go away...weird, annoying, and very disappointing for the price !
customer_reviews.author: GeneG

customer_reviews.title: Great wet-dry electric shaver
customer_reviews.text: The men in my family use this electric razor daily. It has been long lasting and works effectively. This brand also will not break the bank! Good value!
customer_reviews.author: AmazingGrace

customer_reviews.title: Very good shaver. I tried Norelco
customer_reviews.text: Very good shaver. I tried Norelco, didn't like the rotary. Remington wracks my face. Braun too expensive for what you get. Went back to Panasonic. Smooth, Quiet and I can get most of the week with one charge. The older Arc 3 models are priced pretty good, so even after a couple of years of use, I can purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: br

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: My favorite razor, and I like the new improvements on this model.
customer_reviews.author: KSK1

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend, and he loved it! He really liked how much smaller, and sleeker it was than other electric razors. It is easy to clean, and gets really close. The battery life lasts a long time, and it doesn't take long to re-charge. I should note that he isn't super hairy, and I don't know how it would compare to someone that grew thick facial hair, but for trimming and keeping the face clean it is top-notch.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Summers

customer_reviews.title: LOUD.
customer_reviews.text: It shaved fine, but WOW is it LOUD. Registered 94 peak, 108 max and 81 average on my phone’s dB meter. Even if my phone is off by +\-3dB it is still a LOUD shaver. I’ll give it 5 stars because I have no idea if this is normal, but anything over 85 can cause hearing loss.
customer_reviews.author: WESIII

customer_reviews.title: Was good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 9 months now completely dead. Didn't even last a year. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Young

customer_reviews.title: Very loud
customer_reviews.text: Shaved just fine but was really loud which made it uncomfortable for me to use. Returned and got a Braun instead.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole L. Brant

customer_reviews.title: worst Panasonic shaver I've ever seen
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy, no charge indicator, and the clipper attachments are basically worthless. Other Panasonic sharvers I'd had over the years have been great, but not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. Dyas

customer_reviews.title: Best shaver yet for me.
customer_reviews.text: I had been a Norelco fan for years but their quality suffered recently along with rising prices. I tried a Remington foil and it was bad. This shaver cuts closer and is quieter and with more features likes cleaning, shaving wet, etc. Only downside is like most foil shavers, if you miss a whisker 2 days straight the foil won't pick it up. So on those few occasions I use the trimmer blade. It even tells you when to clean it!! Great shaver.
customer_reviews.author: V. Pierson

customer_reviews.title: ... 17 year old ES80167 shaver actually performs about 50% better in shaving close without having to go over the ...
customer_reviews.text: My 17 year old ES80167 shaver actually performs about 50% better in shaving close without having to go over the same spots many many yimes like this razor an is faster. A shame as I wanted a new razor and in fact am not a person with heavy growth.
customer_reviews.author: pcumming

customer_reviews.title: awesome!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: this is by far the best razor I've ever purchased in my 60 years. very clean shave
customer_reviews.author: darrell lisinski

customer_reviews.title: Great Razor
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough about this razor. My husband LOVES it!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Excellet Shaver.
customer_reviews.text: This by far has been the best shaver i have owned thus far. It easy to use, clean, and maintain. the charge last a long time, and the blades are adequately sharp after many uses. The only thing that this shaver does not come with is a case which would be nice to use if you travel. The only thing I do not like is the pop up trimmer. The blades are too sharp and its hard to trim because of the angle of the trimmer. its very difficult to trim using that option.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rosario

customer_reviews.title: Faster, Smoother, Easier
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an old Panasonic razor with this one. Stuck with the brand because they're the best I've used. This one is a nice upgrade. I use it dry. Faster, smoother shave, and easier work. Important, because I shave my entire head with it. I stopped shy of 5 stars because the battery doesn't hold a charge as long as I expected - but that's not to say it's anemic. I get between 3 and 4 full-head shaves. Pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Poor service
customer_reviews.text: I shaved with this about 10 times—not a very close shave. Battery then would not re-charge. I called customer service but got a recorded message they no longer talk to customers!!
customer_reviews.author: David Marsh, MD

customer_reviews.title: So far very pleased with product
customer_reviews.text: So far very pleased with product. Read reviews before I bought.. And agree that , why pay more for something that is for "women" , when this is very high quality. Shaves close and easy to use on legs, and underarms.
customer_reviews.author: Ghoststories 1957

customer_reviews.title: Battery problem
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in August. Loved it, until the battery wouldn't hold a charge. Tried to contact the manufacturer for warranty help, darn near impossible. Do not buy this. No help from seller.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Beehan

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son and he loves it. He says it's so easy to use, and there are no problems with it pulling and a little painful like some other reviewers had written. It's easy, quick and does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: bouga

customer_reviews.title: Overall Okay but I wonder if it is a defected product (razor too hot)
customer_reviews.text: What I like about this shaver are that (1) it shaves quite clean (cleaner than my previous one, which is a Philips shaver) (2) the noise is relatively small. What I don't like about this shaver is that the razor becomes hot very quickly - in just 1-2 seconds!!! The temperature is quite high, above 40 C I believe. I seriously wonder if this particular shaver is a defected product?
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Panasonic razor I've owned. I love them. My old one still works.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great Razor ... works in the shower.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my boyfriend and he tells me that it gives a good clean cut. It's also easy to operate and it works in the shower, as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Sandstress

product_meta.title: Panasonic ES-LT41-K Arc3 Wet Dry Electric Razor, Men's 3-Blade Cordless with Flexible Pivoting Head, Wet/Dry
product_meta.description: Style Name:Arc3 ES-LT41-KThe Panasonic ES-LT41-K Arc3 mens electric razor offers an advanced, high-efficiency three-blade wet dry shaver cutting system for fast, smooth shaving, even on sensitive skin. Each stainless-steel Arc 3 Nanotech blade is sharpened to an ideal 30° edge for exceptional durability and closeness. And the Panasonic shaver's ultra-thin Multi-Fit Arc3 foil and flexible, pivoting action shaver head glide effortlessly along the face, chin and neck for exceptional electric shaver comfort. Together with the peak power and performance of a 13,000 cpm Panasonic Arc 3 linear motor drive, it all adds up to a clean, satisfying shave each and every time. This Arc3 shaving machine is fully waterproof and washable, and designed to perform just as efficiently in the shower using your favorite foam or gel, or used dry anytime. A smart pop-up trimmer in the Panasonic Arc3 body adds the perfect finish and detail to sideburns, mustaches and beards, and the 10-stage LED in the sure-grip handle of the Panasonic electric razor shows battery status and charge indicator. Cleaning your Panasonic Arc 3 is quick and simple. Just rinse the electric razor under running water and let sonic vibration mode remove stubborn gel and stubble, leaving the Arc 3 blades and foil fresh and renewed. The shavers battery charges in one hour to provide peak power for approximately 15 shaves. For shaving and grooming away from home, the Panasonic ES-LT41-K Arc3 electric razor comes with universal voltage, AC adaptor/charger and a travel pouch. Like all Panasonic electric shavers for men, blades and foil should be replaced when dull.
feature_bullets: The Panasonic Arc3 cordless wet dry men's electric razor features a high-efficiency 3-blade cutting system with ultra-sharp 30° Nanotech blades for a fast, close and smooth shaving experience. The number of shaves per charge (3min/1 shave) is approximately 15 shaves

ES-LT41-K includes a 13,000 cpm linear motor drive, an ultra-thin Multi-Fit Arc 3 foil and flexible, pivoting shaving head designed to glide effortlessly over face, chin and neck for enhanced electric shaver comfort
Fully waterproof for wet dry shaving convenience, the Panasonic Arc 3 can be used in the shower or over the sink with foam or gel, or dry anytime it's convenient
This wet dry razor is 100% washable, and includes a sonic vibration mode for easy rinsing and cleaning under running water

Built-in pop up trimmer in the ES-LT41-K trims and details sideburns and mustaches, a 5-stage LED in the Arc3 shaving machine shows power status, and an AC adaptor/charger, travel pouch and universal voltage are included
charging time1 hour and power source is AC 100-240V (Automatic International Dual Voltage Conversion)

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
